meanings.definition: To sell goods by going from place to place.
meanings.sent1: The man would peddle his fresh vegetables in the neighborhood every morning.
meanings.sent2: She decided to peddle her handmade jewelry at the local market.
meanings.sent3: The kids thought it was funny to peddle their toys to each other like little salespeople.
meanings.sent4: He would peddle his stories to anyone who would listen, hoping to make a sale.
meanings.sent5: The street vendor would peddle his delicious snacks, enticing passersby with the aroma.

meanings.definition: To promote or spread (an idea or belief) persistently.
meanings.sent1: The activist would peddle her message of peace and unity at every opportunity.
meanings.sent2: He would peddle conspiracy theories online, trying to convince others of his beliefs.
meanings.sent3: The politician would peddle his promises like a traveling salesman, hoping to win votes.
meanings.sent4: She would peddle her fashion sense to her friends, always trying to influence their style.
meanings.sent5: The teacher would peddle the importance of education to her students, encouraging them to strive for success.
